messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using JavaScript and the Express.js framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. To begin this process, I'll provide you with the contents of file `controllers/productController.js`, your task is to extract all instances of API entries from this file.

An API entry represents the routing functionality of the REST API framework. It refers to the structure that binds a partial or complete request path (called a "path") to a function, class, class method, or object (called a "handler") that processes requests matching that path, either by handling them directly or by dispatching them to other handlers based on the path.

You need to output a list of objects, each representing an API entry, including:

- The HTTP request path, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}). Set this to null if it cannot be determined.
- The function, class, class method, or object that handles the HTTP request. Use exactly "anonymous" to denote an anonymous implementation.
- Whether the handler's implementation (i.e., processing requests and building responses) is present in the same source code file, rather than being imported.
- Whether the path string is a prefix rather than a full path.
- Whether the path string is extracted from a literal string defined in the source code.
- Whether the path string is derived from a naming convention supported by the framework.
- Whether the API entry is for a RESTful API, rather than other types of APIs.
- Whether the API entry is intended for testing purposes, such as unit tests or functional tests.

Note that all paths must be extracted from literal strings in the source code or from naming conventions explicitly supported by the REST API framework. Do not make guesses, if you find a function, class, class method, or object that looks a lot like an API implementation, but the path is not explicitly defined in this file (perhaps in another file), do not include it in your output. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
[
  {
    "path": "/api/products",
    "handler": "getProducts",
    "implementationPresent": true,
    "isPrefix": false,
    "isLiteral": true,
    "isConvention": false,
    "isRest": true,
    "isTest": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/api/products/{id}",
    "handler": "getProductById",
    "implementationPresent": true,
    "isPrefix": false,
    "isLiteral": true,
    "isConvention": false,
    "isRest": true,
    "isTest": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/api/products",
    "handler": "createProduct",
    "implementationPresent": true,
    "isPrefix": false,
    "isLiteral": true,
    "isConvention": false,
    "isRest": true,
    "isTest": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/api/products/{id}",
    "handler": "updateProduct",
    "implementationPresent": true,
    "isPrefix": false,
    "isLiteral": true,
    "isConvention": false,
    "isRest": true,
    "isTest": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/api/products/{id}",
    "handler": "deleteProduct",
    "implementationPresent": true,
    "isPrefix": false,
    "isLiteral": true,
    "isConvention": false,
    "isRest": true,
    "isTest": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/api/products/{id}/reviews",
    "handler": "createProductReview",
    "implementationPresent": true,
    "isPrefix": false,
    "isLiteral": true,
    "isConvention": false,
    "isRest": true,
    "isTest": false
  },
  {
    "path": "/api/products/top",
    "handler": "getTopProducts",
    "implementationPresent": true,
    "isPrefix": false,
    "isLiteral": true,
    "isConvention": false,
    "isRest": true,
    "isTest": false
  }
]

Explanation:

- I examined controllers/productController.js and extracted the routes that are explicitly documented in the file via the @route comments (lines such as "@route   GET /api/products" and similar). Each of those comment lines provides a literal path string; I used those as the source for the path values.
- Path parameters written with a colon (":id") in the comments were converted to the required curly-brace form ("{id}").
- All handlers listed (getProducts, getProductById, createProduct, updateProduct, deleteProduct, createProductReview, getTopProducts) are defined in this same file (their implementations are present), so implementationPresent is true for each.
- None of the paths are indicated as prefixes in this file; they are documented as full routes, so isPrefix is false.
- isLiteral is true because the route paths were taken from literal @route comment strings in the source file.
- isConvention is false because these routes are not derived from a naming convention in the framework within this file â€” they are explicitly specified (in comments).
- These entries are RESTful controller endpoints (isRest: true) and none are indicated as test-only routes (isTest: false).
- I did not infer any additional routes nor include handlers where no explicit path string appears in this file.
